primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God's sovereign movement to annex and justify the ungodly (Jews and Gentiles alike) into a universal plan of salvation that transcends national and moral boundaries.

tekstueel_bewijs: God breaking out of the categories of religion and piety
God has given America a unique role
God makes his sun rise on the evil and on the good

object.identificatie: The justification of the ungodly / Universal salvation
tekstueel_bewijs: God’s purpose for salvation will encompass all the nations
O the depth of the riches and wisdom and knowledge of God!

ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer is explicitly positioned as the Receiver/Object of mercy, not the Subject of action.

helper.identificatie: St. Paul (as herald) and the Holy Spirit (implied in the 'descent of the dove')
tekstueel_bewijs: Paul invites us to join him in God’s way of life
helper.rol_van_god: God is the Subject, not merely a Helper.
helper.rol_van_geest: External power that 'rectifies' the cycle of wrongdoing.

tekstueel_bewijs: atavistic loyalty to our own group
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not just 'bad habits' but the 'colossal and never-ending cycle of wrongdoing' and 'Satan'.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The ethical response of the believer to 'stand in awe' and 'repent' of nationalistic idolatry.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Believer/The American Christian
secundair_narratief_programma.object: Repentance and vigilance over one's own view of God
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The ethical 'way of life' is a response to the primary program of God's justification of the ungodly.

voorbeelden_god_subject: God sees neither the Jews inheriting the kingdom... but both together
God has bestowed qualities of holiness
voorbeelden_mens_subject: We need to wrestle with such questions
We can no longer claim goodness

voorbeelden: special responsibility is to be vigilant
urge to eat and to reproduce
Who has known the mind of the Lord?
we sinners who know ourselves only too well
God who is great enough to rectify all this

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon emphasizes human *impotence* (cannot measure up) and God's *omnipotence* (rectifying the cycle of wrongdoing).

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from S2 (Middle East crisis/sin) to ~S1 (Religion/Nationalism) and finally to S1 (God's sovereign grace).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by God 'annexing' the ungodly, moving them from S2 to S1 without their own performance.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; sin is described as a 'colossal cycle' and 'atavistic'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon consistently maintains God as the primary actor. Even the call to ethics is framed as 'standing in awe' of what God has already done.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: take responsibility for our own 'way of life'

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: God breaking out of the categories of religion... to annex the irreligious
The answer, of course, is that we can’t [measure up].

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Biblical figures are not used as moral examples but as witnesses to God's action.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Paul is not an example of 'how to be ecstatic' but a recipient of a 'dazzling section of Scripture'.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and liberation from the need to be their own judge.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic grace; salvation is entirely God's work.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The political/ethical section is tightly integrated into the theological doxology.
spanning_punten: The tension between America's 'unique role' and the critique of 'God bless America' nationalism.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: the justification of the ungodly... Christ took the place of the ungodly (implied in context of Romans 4:5)

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit bestows 'qualities of holiness' as a gift, not a reward.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is seen as an inescapable tribal instinct and a cycle of wrongdoing that only a 'great God' can rectify.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is a classic theocentric narrative where God is the Subject of all transformative verbs.

modale_balans.huidige_onbalans: Slightly heavy on Devoir (Must) in the political section.
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Connect the 'vigilance' more explicitly to the Spirit's work.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Soteriology (God justifies) → Ethics (We stand in awe).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterful example of theocentric preaching that uses current events to illustrate human limitation and divine sovereignty.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'American way of life' hook; Greimas shows the underlying Subject is God, not the American voter.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains Romans 11; Greimas shows how the sermon *functions* as a narrative of justification.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'foreigners' in the congregation are actantially identical to the 'ungodly' in Paul's text.

volledige_subject_lijst: God (annexes, justifies, makes sun rise, gives role)
appendices.notities: The sermon effectively uses the Potter/Clay metaphor to cement the God-as-Subject structure.
